intro: Tetramerium rzedowskii, commonly known as the Mexican tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a hairy texture. Tetramerium rzedowskii is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
